title: Kinematics graph - displacements from v-t graph

content.question: A cart moves along a straight line. The cart’s velocity as a function of time is shown in the graph. At <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> the cart’s motion changes. Based on the graph, what is the ratio of the magnitude of the cart’s displacement from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to the cart’s displacement from <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
